Name: FTP
Desc: This section lets you configure how the FTP shell works.

Keys.Name: Log FTP username
Keys.Description: Whether or not to log FTP username.

Keys.Name: Log FTP IP address
Keys.Description: Whether or not to log FTP IP address.

Keys.Name: Return only first FTP profile
Keys.Description: Pick the first profile only when connecting.

Keys.Name: Show file details in FTP list
Keys.Description: Shows the FTP file details while listing remote directories.

Keys.Name: Username prompt style for FTP
Keys.Description: Write how you want your login prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Password prompt style for FTP
Keys.Description: Write how you want your password prompt to be. Leave blank to use default style. Placeholders are parsed.

Keys.Name: Use first FTP profile
Keys.Description: Uses the first FTP profile to connect to FTP.

Keys.Name: Add new connections to FTP speed dial
Keys.Description: If enabled, adds a new connection to the FTP speed dial.

Keys.Name: Try to validate secure FTP certificates
Keys.Description: Tries to validate the FTP certificates. Turning it off is not recommended.

Keys.Name: Show FTP MOTD on connection
Keys.Description: Shows the FTP message of the day on login.

Keys.Name: Always accept invalid FTP certificates
Keys.Description: Always accept invalid FTP certificates. Turning it on is not recommended as it may pose security risks.

Keys.Name: Recursive hashing for FTP
Keys.Description: Whether to recursively hash a directory. Please note that not all the FTP servers support that.

Keys.Name: Verify retry attempts for FTP transmission
Keys.Description: How many times to verify the upload and download and retry if the verification fails before the download fails as a whole?

Keys.Name: FTP connection timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before the FTP connection timeout?

Keys.Name: FTP data connection timeout
Keys.Description: How many milliseconds to wait before the FTP data connection timeout?

Keys.Name: FTP IP versions
Keys.Description: Choose the version of Internet Protocol that the FTP server supports and that the FTP client uses.
